detaileddescription.para: This function gets called during initialization of the diagnose module. It clears memory and counters used by diag later on.

This function adds an entry to the error buffer. It provides some functionality to prevent duplicates from being logged. Multiple occurring error doesn't get logged anymore after they reached a pre-defined error count.

briefdescription.para: DIAG_GeneralHandler provides generic error handling, based on configuration.

detaileddescription.para:
This function does all the handling based on the user defined configuration. According to its return value further treatment is left to the calling module itself.
diag_ch_id
event ID of the event that has occurred
event
event that occurred (OK, NOK, RESET)
item_nr
item nr of event, to distinguish between different calling locations of the event
DIAG_STATE_UNINITIALIZED if diag module still uninitialized, DIAG_HANDLER_RETURN_WRONG_ID if invalid diag id, DIAG_HANDLER_INVALID_TYPE if diag id doesn't correspond to diag type, DIAG_HANDLER_RETURN_OK if error/warning occurred but no threshold reached or event = DIAG_EVENT_OK/DIAG_EVENT_RESET, DIAG_HANDLER_RETURN_ERR_OCCURRED if error threshold reached, DIAG_HANDLER_RETURN_WARNING_OCCURRED if warning threshold reached,
This function provides initialization of the diagnose module. In case of miss behaviour it calls Reset and adds an entry into database to ensure data validity/report back malfunction

briefdescription.para: DIAG_PrintErrors prints contents of the error buffer on user request.

detaileddescription.para: This function prints out complete error buffer using the UART interface.

briefdescription.para: DIAG_PrintContactorInfo prints contents of the contactor switching buffer on user request.

detaileddescription.para: This function prints out complete contactor information using the UART interface.

memberdef.argsstring: (DIAG_CH_ID_e diag_ch_id, DIAG_EVENT_e event, uint8_t item_nr, void *data)
memberdef.name: DIAG_Handler

briefdescription.para: DIAG_Handler provides generic error handling, based on diagnosis group.

This function calls the handler functions depending on the diagnosis group of call. It needs to get called in every function which wants to apply some kind of diagnosis handling. According to its return value further treatment is either left to the calling module itself, or can be done in the callback function defined in diag_cfg.c.

parameterdescription.para: event ID of the event that has occurred
item nr of event, to distinguish between different calling locations of the event

simplesect.para: DIAG_HANDLER_RETURN_UNKNOWN if invalid DIAG_TYPE_e, otherwise return value of DIAG_GeneralHandler or DIAG_ContHandler

detaileddescription.para: checks notifications (state and timestamps) of all system-relevant tasks or functions all checks should be customized corresponding to its timing and state requirements

briefdescription.para: DIAG_SysMonNotify has to be called in every function using the system monitoring.

parameterdescription.para: module id to notify system monitoring

briefdescription.para: trap of configuration errors derived by FreeRTOS configASSERT

09.11.2015 (date of creation) Module-prefix
DIAG This diagnose module is responsible for error handling and reporting. Reported errors are logged into the global database and can be reviewed on user request.
